properties.name: play()
properties.description: Plays the timeline.
properties.example: play();

properties.name: stop()
properties.description: Stops the timeline.
properties.example: stop();

properties.name: gotoAndStop(frame)
properties.description: Moves the timeline to a frame number or name and stops that timeline.
properties.example:
gotoAndStop(2);
gotoAndStop('menu');

args.name: frame
args.description: frame number or name to jump to

properties.name: gotoAndPlay(frame)
properties.description: Moves the timeline to a frame number or name and stops that timeline.
properties.example:
gotoAndPlay(2);
gotoAndPlay('menu');

args.name: frame
args.description: frame number or name to jump to

properties.name: gotoNextFrame()
properties.description: Moves the timeline forward one frame.
properties.example: gotoNextFrame();

properties.name: gotoPrevFrame()
properties.description: Moves the timeline backwards one frame.
properties.example: gotoPrevFrame();

properties.name: load
properties.description: Gets called as soon as the object appears on screen.

properties.name: update
properties.description: Gets called every tick.

properties.name: mousedown
properties.description: Gets called when the object is clicked

properties.name: mouseover
properties.description: Gets called when the mouse is over the object.

properties.name: mouseup
properties.description: Gets called when after the mouse clicks the object

properties.name: mouseout
properties.description: Gets called when after the mouse leaves the object

properties.name: keypressed
properties.description: Gets called once when a key is first pressed.

properties.name: keydown
properties.description: Gets called once every update while a key is down.

properties.name: x
properties.description: Refers to the x-location (left-to-right) of the object.
properties.example: this.x += 1; // Moves the object to the right by 1 pixel

properties.name: y
properties.description: Refers to the y-location (top-to-bottom) of the object. Y values increase as you go down on the canvas.
properties.example: this.y += 1; // Moves the object down by one pixel

properties.name: scaleX
properties.description: Scales the width of the object. By default scaleX is set to 1.
properties.example: this.scaleX = 2; // Doubles the width of this object.

properties.name: scaleY
properties.description: Scales the height of the object. By default scaleY is set to 1.
properties.example: this.scaleY = 2; // Doubles the height of this object.

properties.name: rotation
properties.description: Controls the angle of rotation on the object in degrees.
properties.example: this.rotation += 10; // Rotate this object 10 degrees to the right

properties.name: flipX
properties.description: A boolean which determines whether or not to flip the wickObject horizontally. By default flipX is set to false.
properties.example: this.flipX = true; // Flip this object horizontally.

properties.name: flipY
properties.description: A boolean which determines whether or not to flip the wickObject vertically. By default flipY is set to false.
properties.example: this.flipY = true; // Flip this object vertically.

properties.name: opacity
properties.description: A value between 0 and 1 which determines how transparent an object is. 1 is completely opaque while 0 is completely transparent. By default opacity is set to 1.
properties.example: this.opacity = 0.8; // Make this object slightly transparent.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of the object, can be set in the inspector.
properties.example: console.log('My name is ' + this.name)

properties.name: clone()
properties.description: The resulting clone.
properties.example:
// Creates a clone of the current wick object and stores it in the variable myClone
var myClone = this.clone();

return.description: A clone of the WickObject which calls clone().

properties.name: delete()
properties.description: Deletes this WickObject completely.
properties.example: this.delete(); // Removes the wickObject from the scene.

properties.name: hitTest(otherObject, hitTestType)
properties.description: Checks for a collision with another WickObject.

args.name: otherObject
args.description: Wick Object to check for collision with.

args.name: hitTestType
args.description: Type of hit detection to use. Can be 'rectangles' or 'circles'. If no hitTestType is given, hitTest defaults to 'rectangles'

return.description: True if the objects collide, false otherwise.

properties.name: setText(newText)
properties.description: Changes the text of the object (works on text objects only).

args.name: newText
args.description: The text to change the object to.

properties.name: playSound()
properties.description: Plays the sound of the object (works on sound objects only).
properties.example: this.playSound();

properties.name: play()
properties.description: Plays this objects timeline (only usable for Clips).
properties.example: this.play();

properties.name: stopSound()
properties.description: Stops the sound of the object (works on sound objects only).
properties.example: this.stopSound();

properties.name: stop()
properties.description: Stops this objects timeline (only usable for Clips).
properties.example: this.stop();

properties.name: gotoAndStop(frame)
properties.description: Moves this objects timeline to a frame number or name and stops that timeline (only usable for Clips).
properties.example:
this.gotoAndStop(2);
this.gotoAndStop('menu');

args.name: frame
args.description: frame number or name to jump to

properties.name: gotoAndPlay(frame)
properties.description: Moves the object's timeline to a frame number or name and stops the object's timeline (only usable for Clips).
properties.example:
this.gotoAndPlay(2);
this.gotoAndPlay('menu');

args.name: frame
args.description: frame number or name to jump to

properties.name: playheadPosition
properties.description: The position of the playhead of the object (works on Clip and Button objects only).

properties.name: enterFullscreen()
properties.description: Makes the project fullscreen.
properties.example: enterFullscreen();

properties.name: hideCursor()
properties.description: Makes the cursor invisible.
properties.example: hideCursor();

properties.name: showCursor()
properties.description: Makes the cursor visible.
properties.example: showCursor();

properties.name: stopAllSounds()
properties.description: Stops any sounds currently being played.
properties.example: stopAllSounds();

properties.name: mute()
properties.description: Mutes the entire project (no sounds will play).
properties.example: mute();

properties.name: unmute()
properties.description: Unmutes the enite project (sounds will play again).
properties.example: unmute();

properties.name: project.getObject(name)
properties.description: Returns the object with the requested name.
properties.example:
// Returns the object named 'The Bee'
project.getObject('The Bee')

return.description: The object with the requested name.

properties.name: project.width
properties.description: The width of the project
properties.example: project.width

properties.name: project.height
properties.description: The height of the project
properties.example: project.height

properties.name: mouseX
properties.description: The x-location of the mouse on the project canvas. The origin (0,0) is the upper-left corner of the canvas.
properties.example:
// Sets the object's x-position to the mouse's x-position.
this.x = mouseX

properties.name: mouseY
properties.description: The y-location of the mouse on the project canvas. The origin (0,0) is the upper-left corner of the canvas.
properties.example:
// Sets the object's y-position to the mouse's y-position.
this.y = mouseY

properties.name: mouseMoveX
properties.description: The amount the mouse moved on the x-axis during the last tick.

properties.name: mouseMoveY
properties.description: The amount the mouse moved on the y-axis during the last tick.

properties.name: keyIsDown(key)
properties.description: Returns true if 'key' is currently down and false otherwise. Casing does not matter i.e. keyIsDown('a') is equivalent to keyIsDown('A').

args.name: key
args.description: Any character such as 'A' or special characters including 'SPACE', 'UP', 'DOWN', 'LEFT', 'RIGHT', 'BACKSPACE', 'TAB', 'ENTER', 'SHIFT', 'CTRL', 'COMMAND', 'ALT', 'WINDOWS', 'F1', 'NUM 0', 'NUM LOCK'

return.description: true if key is down, false otherwise.

properties.name: keyJustPressed(key)
properties.description: Returns true if 'key' was just pressed and false otherwise. Casing does not matter i.e. keyJustPressed('a') is equivalent to keyJustPressed('A').

args.name: key
args.description: Any character such as 'A' or special characters including 'SPACE', 'UP', 'DOWN', 'LEFT', 'RIGHT', 'BACKSPACE', 'TAB', 'ENTER', 'SHIFT', 'CTRL', 'COMMAND', 'ALT', 'WINDOWS', 'F1', 'NUM 0', 'NUM LOCK'

return.description: true if key was just pressed, false otherwise.

properties.name: tiltX
properties.description: Returns the x-coordinate tilt of the device. This function only works on devices with an accelerometer/gyroscope (such as smartphones).
properties.example:
// Move this object in the direction of the device's tilt
this.x = tiltX;

properties.name: tiltY
properties.description: Returns the y-coordinate tilt of the device. This function only works on devices with an accelerometer/gyroscope (such as smartphones)
properties.example:
// Move this object in the direction of the device's tilt
this.y = tiltY;

properties.name: this
properties.description: When used inside of a script, ‘this’ refers to the symbol the script belongs to.
properties.example:
// Move the symbol which ran this script to the right by one pixel
this.x += 1;

properties.name: root
properties.description: Refers to the 'root' object. The root object contains all other objects. The root object has no parent and holds the 'root' timeline which controls the main information being shown. The keyword root can be used in any script.
properties.example:
// Moves the playhead on the root timeline to frame 2 and stops the root timeline
root.gotoAndStop(2);

properties.name: parentObject
properties.description: Refers to the parent of the object. 'parent' can be used to access the parent object's timeline, or other objects contained within the parent.
properties.example:
// Moves the playhead on the parent obect's timeline to frame 2 and plays that timeline
parent.gotoAndPlay(2);

properties.name: random.bool()
properties.description: Generates a random boolean (a value that can be either true or false). See this page for more info.

return.description: A random boolean. Will be true 50% of the time.

properties.name: random.integer(min,max)
properties.description: Generates a random whole number from min to max. See this page for more info.

args.name: min
args.description: The generated number will be greater than or equal to min

args.name: max
args.description: The generated number will be less than or equal to max

properties.name: random.real(min,max)
properties.description: Generates a random real (fractional) number from min to max. See this page for more info.
properties.example:
// Use random.real to choose how transparent an object appears.
this.opacity = random.real(0,1);

args.name: min
args.description: The generated number will be greater than or equal to min

args.name: max
args.description: The generated number will be less than or equal to max

properties.name: elapsedSeconds()
properties.description: Returns the number of seconds since the project was started.

return.description: The number of seconds since the project was started.

properties.name: elapsedMilliseconds()
properties.description: Returns the number of milliseconds since the project was started.

return.description: The number of milliseconds since the project was started.

properties.name: elapsedTicks()
properties.description: Returns the number of frames since the project was started.

return.description: The number of frames since the project was started.

properties.name: Math.abs(value)
properties.description: TODO: description
properties.example: TODO: example

properties.name: alert(message)
properties.description: Displays a popup window with the message given.
properties.example: alert('Hello!!');

properties.name: prompt(message)
properties.description: Prompts the user with a popup and a text input field.
properties.example:
var name = prompt('What is your name?');
alert('Your name is ' + name);

properties.name: window.open(url)
properties.description: Opens a new window with the given url.
properties.example: window.open('http://www.wickeditor.com/')

properties.name: localStorage
properties.description: Use the localStorage object to save data. See this page for more info
